questions.question_text: Which two technologies comprise a Cisco Presence deployment? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A and C you do need the Presence Server ready and the Call Manager for both to work

questions.question_text: An end user wants to log in to extension mobility, what are the user prerequisites? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
simply if we try to login to IP Phone by ext. mobility
the required is user ID and PIN
also, if we go to end user page in CUCM administration page the user requires User ID & PIN and these parameters used in ext. mobility
A and D should be correct answer

This now confusing as Everywhere on the internet says A and B (UserID and Password)
But knowing the correct answer is UserID and PIN - A and D
Can somebody find a correct Cisco explanation and share on the discussion?

kikx3 is right:

Users access Cisco Extension Mobility by pressing the Services or Applications button on a Cisco Unified IP Phone and then entering login information in the form of a Cisco Unified Communications Manager UserID and a Personal Identification Number (PIN).
B and C are pretty same so because you can choose only one you must go A :-D (yep, one of the most stupid Cisco questions testing everything but candidate's knowledge)
I don't believe that the correct answer is Ephone-dn 1 Dual-line. The answer should either be ephone-dn 3 dual-line or ephone-dn 2 dual-line.

questions.question_text: What command will add a second line to a ephone-dn?
Which three models of configuration does Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express support? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
PBX Model
Keyswitch Model
Hybrid Model

A B and C is the correct answer
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucme/admin/configuration/manual/cmeadm/cmeover.html

choices.D: Can only be seen in a sniffer trace.
choices.B: Use Cisco Unified Serviceability network trace.
choices.C: Can only be seen in Cisco SDI traces.
choices.A: Run the codec trace in Cisco Unified Communication Manager.
choices.E: Press the button twice on one of the IP phones. E

discussion.content: E. Press the "?" button twice on one of the IP phones.

questions.question_text: How can an administrator determine which codec is being used between two endpoints while a call is in progress?
questions.answer_description:
Explanation -
pressing the button (?) twice in quick succession during an active call. The display shows you receive and transmit statistics for the call.
Reference:
Link:
http://docwiki.cisco.com/wiki/Cisco_Unified_Communications_--_One-Way_Audio
